Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.Server
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
Server instance that handles games and connections with players.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.ArrayList<GameController> gameControllers
    The list of the games controllers.
    private Logger logger
    The server logger.
    private java.util.ArrayList<VirtualView> players
    The list of the server-side interfaces with the clients.
    private int port
    The port on which the server is listening for a connection.
    private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean running
    Specifies if the server is running.
    private java.net.ServerSocket socket
    The server socket.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Server​(int port)
    Server constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void checkAlive​(VirtualView player)
    Continuously suspends the Thread execution for 5 seconds and then checks if the Player is still connected by calling the checkAlive method.
    private void gameWorker​(GameController gameController)
    Gives control to the gameController, to handle the setup and the execution of the associated Game.
    private void joinRoom​(VirtualView player)
    Allows a Player to join an existing Game.
    private void newPlayerWorker​(java.net.Socket client)
    This method starts on a new Thread for each client connecting to the server.
    private void newRoom​(VirtualView player)
    Handles the creation of a new Game room.
    private void playerLobby​(VirtualView player)
    Handles the choice of the Player to create a new Game or to join an existing one.
    void removeGame​(GameController gameController)
    When a Game ends, removes the associated gameController from the list of the active gameControllers.
    private void removePlayer​(VirtualView player)
    Removes a Player when he disconnected.
    void start()
    Starts the server by: creating a new Logger; creating a new ServerSocket at the previously specified port, which will be used to accept the requests of connections from the clients; creating a new Socket instance for each client connecting to the server, establishing the communication channel between that client and the server; starting a new Thread for each client connecting to the server.
    private void startGame​(GameController gameController)
    Starts the Game after notifying the Game's creator.
    private void stop()
    Closes the logger, notifies all players that the server is closing and closes the socket.

  • Field Details

    • running

      private final java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean running
      Specifies if the server is running.

    • port

      private final int port
      The port on which the server is listening for a connection.

    • gameControllers

      private final java.util.ArrayList<GameController> gameControllers
      The list of the games controllers.

    • players

      The list of the server-side interfaces with the clients.

      The server socket.

      The server logger.

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server​(int port)
      Server constructor.
      Parameters:
      port - the port the Server Socket will be connected to

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the server by:
      • creating a new Logger;
      • creating a new ServerSocket at the previously specified port, which will be used to accept the requests of connections from the clients;
      • creating a new Socket instance for each client connecting to the server, establishing the communication channel between that client and the server;
      • starting a new Thread for each client connecting to the server.

    • stop

      private void stop()
      Closes the logger, notifies all players that the server is closing and closes the socket.

    • newPlayerWorker

      private void newPlayerWorker​(java.net.Socket client)
      This method starts on a new Thread for each client connecting to the server. Creates a new VirtualView for the client, providing the Socket and the associated ObjectInputStream and ObjectOutputStream. Asks the client to choose his nickname (which can't be duplicated and must be no longer that 12 characters). Starts a new Thread which will permanently check if the Player is still connected.
      Parameters:
      client - the Socket instance created for this client

    • checkAlive

      private void checkAlive​(VirtualView player)
      Continuously suspends the Thread execution for 5 seconds and then checks if the Player is still connected by calling the checkAlive method.
      Parameters:
      player - the VirtualView associated to the Player whose aliveness needs to be checked

    • playerLobby

      private void playerLobby​(VirtualView player)
      Handles the choice of the Player to create a new Game or to join an existing one.
      Parameters:
      player - the VirtualView representing the Player who previously connected to the server

    • newRoom

      private void newRoom​(VirtualView player) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Handles the creation of a new Game room. Asks to the Player to choose the Game name, not allowing duplicates. When a new Game room is created, creates its GameController.
      Parameters:
      player - the VirtualView representing the Player who is creating the Game room
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • joinRoom

      private void joinRoom​(VirtualView player) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Allows a Player to join an existing Game. The Player can:
      • choose a Game room to join;
      • refresh the list of the currently active Game rooms;
      • go back to the previous screen.
      The Game in the Game Room starts when the expected number of participants joined.
      Parameters:
      player - the VirtualView representing the Player who is joining the Game room
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • startGame

      private void startGame​(GameController gameController) throws IOExceptionFromController
      Starts the Game after notifying the Game's creator.
      Parameters:
      gameController - the GameController for this Game
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • gameWorker

      private void gameWorker​(GameController gameController)
      Gives control to the gameController, to handle the setup and the execution of the associated Game. When the Game ends, calls removeGame so that it can be removed from the list of the active Games.
      Parameters:
      gameController - the gameController of the Game

    • removeGame

      public void removeGame​(GameController gameController)
      When a Game ends, removes the associated gameController from the list of the active gameControllers. If a Player doesn't disconnect after the Game ends, allows him to start a new Game or joining an existing one by redirecting him to the lobby.
      Parameters:
      gameController - the gameController of the Game to be removed

    • removePlayer

      private void removePlayer​(VirtualView player)
      Removes a Player when he disconnected.
      Parameters:
      player - the VirtualView representing the Player to be removed
